title: Automatically filter out deleted items
message:
Automatically filter out deleted items

Currently, deletion is a two-step process. Items are marked for deletion
by setting a flag. Once marked for deletion, the SyncEngine will attempt
to propagate the deletions to the server. Once confirmed deleted from
the server, they will be properly deleted.

This makes this even more transparent by automatically filtering out any
deleted items unless a special query is made. This makes marking an item
for deletion approximately the same as deleting it - as far as queries
go. A special flag can be added to return all items, including deleted
ones, which the SyncEngine uses.

title: Major rework of the SyncEngine
message:
Major rework of the SyncEngine

DB updates: adds "dirty" column to JsonSyncableItem

This changes the way the sync engine checks to see if content is up to
date by introducing a "dirty" column. Whenever an insert or update is
done on the database using the SyncableSimpleContentProvider, it marks
that row dirty (unless SyncableProvider.FLAG_DO_NOT_CHANGE_DIRTY is
used). Dirty rows will be published up to the server. To go the other
direction, the last modified date sent from the server is sent and
compared. This should hopefully fix the issue that age-based
synchronization was having (lots more GET/PUT churn than expected).

It now only does age-based synchronization when both sides have been
marked dirty. While not the best conflict resolution, it's a start and
makes sense for resolving conflicts done by the same user.
